1:
A person who has received many rebukes but who stiffens his neck\q will be broken in a moment beyond healing.

\q
2:
When righteous people increase, the people rejoice,\q but when a wicked person is the ruler, the people sigh.


\q
3:
Whoever loves wisdom makes his father rejoice,\q but he who keeps company with prostitutes destroys his wealth.
\q
4:
The king establishes the land by justice,\q but the one who demands bribes tears it down.


\q
5:
A man who flatters his neighbor\q is spreading a net for his feet.
\q
6:
In the sin of an evil person is a trap,\q but the righteous person sings and rejoices.
\q
7:
The righteous person pleads the cause of poor people;\q the wicked person does not understand such knowledge.
\q
8:
Mockers set a city on fire,\q but those who are wise turn away wrath.


\q
9:
When a wise person has an argument with a fool,\q he rages and laughs, and there will be no rest.
\q
10:
The bloodthirsty hate the one who is blameless\q and seek the life of the upright.


\q
11:
A fool reveals all his anger,\q but a wise man holds it back and calms himself down.
\q
12:
If a ruler pays attention to lies,\q all his officials will be wicked.


\q
13:
The poor person and the oppressor are similar,\q for Yahweh gives light to the eyes of them both.
\q
14:
If a king judges the poor by the truth,\q his throne will be established forever.


\q
15:
The rod and reproof give wisdom,\q but a child freed from discipline puts his mother to shame.
\q
16:
When wicked people are in power, transgression increases,\q but righteous people will see the downfall of those wicked people.

\q
17:
Discipline your son and he will give you rest;\q he will bring delights into your life.
\q
18:
Where there is no prophetic vision the people run wild,\q but the one who keeps the law is blessed.


\q
19:
A slave will not be corrected by words,\q for though he understands, there will be no response.
\q
20:
See a man who is hasty in his words?\q There is more hope for a fool than for him.


\q
21:
One who pampers his slave from youth,\q at the end of it there will be trouble.
\q
22:
An angry person stirs up strife\q and a master of rage commits many sins.


\q
23:
A person's pride brings him low,\q but one who has a humble spirit will be given honor.
\q
24:
One who shares with a thief hates his own life;\q he hears the curse and says nothing.


\q
25:
The fear of man makes a snare,\q but the one who trusts in Yahweh will be protected.
\q
26:
Many are those who seek the face of the ruler,\q but from Yahweh is justice for a person.


\q
27: An unjust man is an abomination to righteous people,\q but the one whose way is upright is detestable to the wicked person.
